DataElement.preferredName: Investigational Medical Device Manufacturer Clinical Trial Expedited Safety Report Source
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A device that is the subject of clinical investigation or research to determine the safety or effectiveness of the device. Investigational devices include transitional devices (21 CFR 812.3(r)) that are objects of investigations. An investigational device may be an approved device that is being studied for an unapproved use or efficacy._Records describing relevant findings and notifications of unexpected serious adverse reactions and other safety information, which is submitted by a sponsor to regulatory authorities, investigators, and Institutional Review Boards (IRBs)/Independent Ethics Committees (IECs)._Where something is available or from where it originates._Records describing relevant findings and notifications of unexpected serious adverse reactions and other safety information, which is submitted by a sponsor to regulatory authorities, investigators, and Institutional Review Boards (IRBs)/Independent Ethics Committees (IECs)._Where something is available or from where it originates.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A device that is the subject of clinical investigation or research to determine the safety or effectiveness of the device. Investigational devices include transitional devices (21 CFR 812.3(r)) that are objects of investigations. Concepts.definition: A device that is the subject of clinical investigation or research to determine the safety or effectiveness of the device. Investigational devices include transitional devices (21 CFR 812.3(r)) that are objects of investigations. An investigational device may be an approved device that is being studied for an unapproved use or efficacy.
A person, enterprise, or entity that produces finished goods.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person appointed by the company to speak on its behalf and/or to provide defined service and work.

Concepts.definition: A person appointed by the company to speak on its behalf and/or to provide defined service and work.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person who uses goods or services.

Concepts.definition: A person who uses goods or services.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person or group with authority to allot or deal out or apportion.

Concepts.definition: A person or group with authority to allot or deal out or apportion.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not belonging to that in which it is contained; introduced from an outside source.

Concepts.definition: Not belonging to that in which it is contained; introduced from an outside source.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person qualified to be engaged in activity directed at preservation of mental and physical health by diseases prevention and treatment as a source of livelihood.

Concepts.definition: A person qualified to be engaged in activity directed at preservation of mental and physical health by diseases prevention and treatment as a source of livelihood.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A printed or electronic work offered for distribution.

Concepts.definition: A printed or electronic work offered for distribution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.

Concepts.definition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.
A hospital, ambulatory surgical facility, nursing home, outpatient diagnostic facility, or outpatient treatment facility which is not a physician's office.
